Description: Handle fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora; handle turns down sharply; rectangular stamp. Clay relatively fine, porous, very small mica; thick beige slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Name Ieron. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0646.12.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0902)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 2002.89 (Former Incorrect MFA accession No.)
Miscellaneous number: Cls.Inv.29 (Former MFA FIC/INV No.)
Miscellaneous number: P.5818 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
